iching.title: Wisdom of the I Ching
iching.subtitle: Receive ancient wisdom through the oracle of changes
iching.prompt: Calm your mind and press the button to receive guidance.
iching.meihuaHint: Time Reading uses Meihua numerology based on the current moment
iching.changingHint: Click on a line to toggle changing status
iching.question: Your Question (Optional)
iching.loginToSave: Please log in to save readings
iching.aiError: An error occurred while generating the interpretation.

wisdom.defaultMeaning: A detailed interpretation of this hexagram is needed.
wisdom.defaultCoreWisdom: Explore the wisdom of this hexagram.
wisdom.compatibilityComplementary: Complementary — harmony of heaven and earth
wisdom.adviceSameElement: Mutual understanding but may lack diversity.
wisdom.adviceDiverse: Embrace differences and learn — growth follows.
wisdom.periodActionTemplate: Harness the energy of {keyword} to seek progress in the {area} area.
wisdom.genderMale: Follow the virtue of the noble one and advance with strength.
wisdom.genderFemale: Exercise the embracing power of Kun virtue (坤德).
wisdom.lifeLessonTemplate: The life lesson from hexagram {name}: Deeply understand the meaning of {keyword}, beware of {warning}, and move toward {opportunity}.

analysis.hoGwaExplanation: Extracted from the inner core (lines 2-5) of the primary hexagram, representing the essence and core energy of the situation.
analysis.hoGwaMeaning1: Strong creative power and drive are hidden within.
analysis.hoGwaMeaning2: Flexibility and receptivity are at the core of the situation.
analysis.hoGwaMeaning11: Inner harmony and balance are achieved.
analysis.hoGwaMeaning12: There is a blockage, but seeds of change exist.
analysis.hoGwaMeaning30: Brightness and clarity are the core energy.
analysis.hoGwaMeaningDefault: The energy of essential transformation is at work.
analysis.chakGwaExplanation: A hexagram formed by swapping line pairs, revealing different aspects of relationships and interactions.
analysis.chakGwaRelationship: It signifies a role reversal in complementary relationships.
analysis.doGwaExplanation: The hexagram flipped 180°, representing the opposite perspective or reversed viewpoint.
analysis.doGwaViewpoint: It hints at the other party's perspective or the situation after time has passed.
analysis.sangbanGwaExplanation: A hexagram with all yin-yang reversed, representing a completely opposite situation or force.
analysis.sangbanForce: It suggests a time when balance with opposing energy is needed.
analysis.bokGwaExplanation: Upper and lower trigrams exchanged, signifying inner-outer transformation or position change.
analysis.bokTransformation: It hints that the positions of inner and outer, cause and effect, may switch.
analysis.haekGwaExplanation: The core sub-trigrams representing the central energy of the hexagram.
analysis.haekEnergyTemplate: The combination of lower core {lower}({lowerNature}) and upper core {upper}({upperNature}) is the essence of the situation.
analysis.trigramDynamicDefault: The interaction between {lowerNature} and {upperNature} is key.
analysis.trigramDynamic_건건: Heaven doubled — peak of strength and vigor.
analysis.trigramDynamic_곤곤: Earth doubled — ultimate receptivity and embrace.
analysis.trigramDynamic_감감: Water doubled — deep wisdom and trials.
analysis.trigramDynamic_리리: Fire doubled — brightness and clarity emphasized.
analysis.trigramDynamic_건곤: Heaven and earth meet — peace and harmony.
analysis.trigramDynamic_곤건: Earth and heaven blocked — difficulties ahead.
analysis.yaoPos3: Turning point, boundary of inner and outer
analysis.yaoResonant: Line {pos} harmonizes with its corresponding line, cooperation is possible.
analysis.yaoNotResonant: Line {pos}'s correspondence is weak, independent effort is needed.
analysis.changingNone: 【Unchanging】 No changing lines — focus on the primary hexagram's judgment.
analysis.changingSingle: 【Single change】 Only line {line} changes — the line statement of line {line} in the primary hexagram is key.
analysis.changingDouble: 【Double change】 Lines {lines} change. Focus on the upper line {upper}'s statement.
analysis.changingTriple: 【Triple change】 Read both primary and resulting hexagram judgments, with the primary as focus.
analysis.changingQuadruple: 【Four changes】 Among the unchanged lines {unchanged}, read line {lower}'s statement in the resulting hexagram.
analysis.changingQuintuple: 【Five changes】 Only line {line} remains unchanged. This unchanging line's statement in the resulting hexagram is key.
analysis.changingSix: 【All lines change】 All 6 lines change — read the resulting hexagram's judgment.
analysis.changingSixYongJiu: 【All change - Yong Jiu (用九)】 "見群龍無首 吉" — Many dragons appear with no head — auspicious.
analysis.changingSixYongYuk: 【All change - Yong Yuk (用六)】 "利永貞" — Persisting in correctness is favorable.
analysis.transitionAdvice0: Deeply understand the essence of the current situation and follow it.
analysis.transitionAdvice1: The position of the changing line is key. Focus on that moment.
analysis.transitionAdvice2: The two changes are connected. The upper line is more important.
analysis.transitionAdvice3: Focus on the primary hexagram, but also reference the resulting hexagram.
analysis.transitionAdvice4: Find answers in what doesn't change. The unchanging element is key.
analysis.transitionAdvice5: The only unchanging line is the anchor of the situation.
analysis.transitionAdvice6Default: A time of complete transformation. Follow the wisdom of the resulting hexagram.
analysis.transitionAdvice6YongJiu: Let go of forcefulness and humbly receive — that is auspicious.
analysis.transitionAdvice6YongYuk: Maintaining the right path to the end brings strength.
analysis.keyMomentYongJiu: Pure Yang (純陽) becomes Pure Yin (純陰) — heaven's energy descends to earth.
analysis.keyMomentYongYuk: Pure Yin (純陰) becomes Pure Yang (純陽) — earth's energy rises to heaven.
analysis.overallInsight: The primary hexagram has {upperNature}({upperKo}) above {lowerNature}({lowerKo}). The inner core (nuclear hexagram) carries the energy of {hoGwa}.
analysis.adviceLeader: You can achieve harmony from a leadership position.
analysis.adviceStable: Overall structure is stable — maintain the current state.
analysis.adviceUnstable: Many unstable elements — respond flexibly to changes.
analysis.adviceCooperate: Opportunities for cooperation and harmony — leverage relationships.
analysis.adviceDefault: Maintain the middle way and wait for the right time.
analysis.compareDifference: {count} lines differ, showing contrast and change in these areas.

about.whatIsText: The I Ching, or Book of Changes, is one of the oldest and most profound wisdom texts in human history. Dating back over 3,000 years, it has guided emperors, scholars, and seekers of truth through life's complexities.
about.hexagramsText: The I Ching consists of 64 hexagrams, each made of six lines that can be solid (Yang) or broken (Yin). These hexagrams represent all possible situations and transformations in the universe.
about.castingText: Traditionally cast with yarrow stalks or three coins, the I Ching responds to your sincere questions. The resulting hexagram offers wisdom about your current situation and potential changes ahead.
about.changingText: Some lines may be 'changing' - transforming from Yin to Yang or vice versa. These changing lines reveal the dynamic nature of your situation and point toward future developments.
